title: How many Dune novels are there? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are ton of them…  Frank Herbert, the creator of Dune Saga, wrote first six books that includes; Dune (1965) :- Set several years into the future, where humanity expanded into far reaches of the space and created a feudal intergalactic society ruled by royal houses, who are controlled by a Padishah Emperor of House Corrino, the sovereign of the known universe. The book follows Paul Atreides, heir to the House Atreides, who, along with his family, moves to a desert planet, Arrakis, the universe's only source of the spice melange, and what follows is a series of deceit, betrayal and unexpected events that changes the fate of known universe/Imperium.Dune Messiah (1969) :- Set twelve years after the events of Dune, Paul is witnessing the events, that he had already perceived from his vision, which he couldn’t prevent and has to face the consequences of it.Children of Dune (1976) :- Set nine years after the events of the last book, it follows the adventures of Paul’s twin children, Leto II and Ghanima and their rise to power.God Emperor of Dune (1981) :- It is 3500 years since the events of Children of Dune happened, when Leto II, sacrificed his humanity to avoid human extinction and he now transformed into something that is closer to what can be considered as a god and he has to ensure the survival of humanity, for a long period of time.Heretics of Dune (1984) :- 1500 years have passed since the events of god-emperor, when, Leto II, had caused an explosion of humanity into the unknown universe. But, now some of them are coming back, with an intend to conquer, now Bene Gesserit have to face a choice, either embrace their traditional ways or lead humanity forward.Chapterhouse: Dune (1985) :- Bene Gesserit is still in conflict with the invaders, who are succeeding in their ways to control the universe and destroying everything that is preventing them from achieving their goal.The Chapterhouse: Dune was left with a cliffhanger, due to the death of Frank Herbert. Then, his son, Brian Herbert along with Kevin J Anderson, stepped on Frank’s shoes. to expand Dune Universe. They began with Prequel trilogies, with Prelude to Dune, as the first set of trilogies, that takes place during the events, right before the first Dune book. Dune: House Atreides (1999) :- The book mainly follows the life of Leto, of House Atreides, as a young man, studying politics, to succeed his father’s position as ruler of the planet Caladan.Dune: House Harkonnen (2000) :- The book mainly follows the life of young Baron Harkonnen of the planet Geidi Prime and his rise to power.Dune: House Corrino (2001) :- This one mainly follows, Padishah Emperor Shadam IV, and his struggle with controlling the Imperium and also have to endure the war of assasins.Then they continued with second set of prequel trilogies, Legends of Dune, which takes place 10,000 years before the events of the first Dune book, and it chronicles the events of Butlerian Jihad and the rise of houses and several organisations, that exists in the main Dune Saga. Dune: Butlerian Jihad (2002) :- This books shows the initial days of the Jihad by thinking machines against humanity.Dune: The Machine Crusade (2003) :- Set during the peak of the Jihad, the characters from the first book are back, to launch crusade against Thinking machines.Dune: The Battle of Corrin (2004) :- Known universe is experiencing the waning days of the Jihad and the crusade, at the same time, political climate is morphing into the one, that was seen in the original Dune.Another prequel series, released after this was, Heroes of Dune, which fills the gap, in between the gaps of the original Frank Herbert’s Dune saga. Paul of Dune (2008):- The story is about the life of Paul Atreides, during the Jihad that took place in between the original Dune and Dune Messiah and also his experiences during the War of Assassins.The Winds of Dune (2009) :- The story follows Lady Jessica during the events, in between Dune Messiah and The Children of Dune.Then comes, the Schools of Dune, which is an ongoing series, that is set right after the events of Butlerian Jihad, and tells the stories of the rise of great schools during the reign of Corrino Empire. Sisterhood of Dune (2012) :- This book tells the rise of Bene Gesserit, several decades after Battle of Corrin.Mentats of Dune (2014) :- The book tells the rise of mentats, centuries after Butlerian Jihad.Navigators of the Dune (2016) :-The book tells rise of Spacing Guild and it’s navigators.In between all of this, they also wrote two sequels to the Chapterhouse, based on the drafts left by, Frank Herbert. Hunters of Dune (2006) :- The book continues the story, left by the Chapterhouse Dune, humanity is still facing the danger caused by an unknown enemy,Sandworms of Dune (2007) :- Conclusion to the Frank Herbert’s Dune saga, which shows the return of characters from the original Dune saga as well as the prequels.

Frank Herbert wrote six novels between 1965 and 1985: Dune, Dune Messiah, Children of Dune, God-Emperor of Dune, Heretics of Dune and Chapterhouse Dune. Chapterhouse ended on a cliffhanger, but Herbert died in 1986, before he could write a sequel. Starting in 1999, Frank’s son Brian and Kevin J. Anderson began writing a series of prequels and sequels, which currently stand at 13 novels. In rough order o publication, they are: The Prelude to Dune trilogy, which details the events leading to Dune: House Atredies, House Harkonnen and House Corrino The Legends of Dune trilogy, which depicts the war that lead to the foundation of the Imperial system: The Butlerian Jihad, The Machine Crusade and The Battle of Corin Two sequels to Chapterhouse Dune: Hunters of Dune and Sandworms of Dune The Heroes of Dune series, which fill in the gaps between Frank Herbert’s novels: Paul of Dune (set between Dune and Dune Messiah) and Winds of Dune (set between Dune Messiah and Children of Dune. Apparently two more books are planned in this series. The Great Schools of Dune trilogy, set after Legends of Dune, it details the rise of the non=noble powers in the Dune universe: Sisterhood of Dune, Mentats of Dune, and Navigators of Dune So that’s a total of 19 novels, with two more at least mentioned to be planned. If you want to round it up to 20, there’s also The Dune Encyclopedia, published between God-Emperor and Heretics, which was authorised by Frank Herbert, but has contradicted the original books at some points, and has been ignored by Brian Herbert and Kevin J. Anderson
